title: AAI: systematically addressing the attribute release problem

author: Jozef Mišutka, Institute of Formal and Applied Linguistics (ÚFAL), Charles University Prague

segmentation: So I have two goals for this presentation.
The first one is not to sound as boring as the title may suggest.
And Secondly, to give you a brief overview about the tool we created in the client plus Pro.
But firstly, really just a brief overview.
One of the pillars of clearing is that every scholar should have a single sign-on access for research purposes.
What does that mean?
It means you have to have a username and a password and you should be able with this one username and password.
Access the resources data services in the cloud infrastructure.
Why?
Well, some of the some of the services or some of the data may be restricted by your restrictive license because all data has to have license and the service would like you to sign a license.
So that's why you need username and password or you would like to see the history of searches in a web service.
That's why you need to be identified.
That's also why we need the username and password.
And finally, for example, for group collaboration you have to identify your colleagues, so that's why we need this identity.
But as a service provider you have to have also some requirements put on these identities.
These are by no means the only requirements, but these are the basic ones.
First of all, you would like the user to be identified to a real person.
You would like the user to be identified to a real person in time and also to the same person in time.
So when someone signs a license, it would be nice in five years to know that who signed it and that is the same person.
And also, if your service requires more information, like an email like affiliation, entitlement, you should get these basic attributes.
But even with these two simple requirements, there are already a lot of problems going on.
One of them is that the registration policies are really different and.
And there are I DPS who does not identify you because the big advantage of the home organization give you identity is that they are trustworthy.
It means that when you are at the University, you will not get an academic degree without someone identifying you.
And also we will not get a salary in an Institute without being identified.
So that's one advantage of this.
But if there is an IDP who just doesn't require anything but an email This is a problem.
And the second problem is that the attribute are not released as you would like to and This is why this is what this presentation is about.
There are many more problems, however, I would like to stop here.
Stop complaining and let's look at the positive side.
So what is the state of the art of the authentication and authorization infrastructure?

So the positive thing is that there are no technical real technical problems, so usually that's configuration problems, or that the identity's, the identity providers just like knowledge or they are very mistrusting, so they just say that nothing will be released.
But these are not technical problems.
The other issue is that there are thousands of identity providers in the world.
In the Clarion Service provider Federation there are around.
One and a half thousand of identity providers.
So here there are two and a half thousand, which is also including other Inter Federation in their federations.
Um, the results have been introduced large by the community because they needed more home organizations to attend, so they minimize the requirements and so on and so forth.
So there are a lot of problems we would like to focus an on two of them.
And I will in more detail speak about one of them, which is the attribute release.

Um, to be even more positive, I have to say that from our experience, the situation, the quality of Inter federating has improved and I also dare to say that in some aspects the improvements have been thanks to the Clarion to all the people working on the current service provider Federation and also to the service providers.
However this came at a cost.
And the cost were many many hours spent in monitoring in just dealing with those identity providers.
Now the question is, can we do better?
And also in the service provider, Federation grows and grows.
It would be very difficult.
To maintain and to ask all of the service providers to do a lot of additional work.
So the answer is yes.
We can do better and we can do better by creating a tool that simplifies life of the service providers.
They will just diploid ones.
An unless they really want to, they can just forget and the quality of the Inter Federation will improve for them.
The same goes for ID.
Entity providers, because I have the clearing service provider Federation is set up.
We can tell an IDP provider to use specific rules and it will work from that time to all current and future service providers in the SPF.
So this is also very important.
Just imagine you are a maintainer of an IDP and you will get 30 emails from 30 service providers in the SPF asking them to just fix the attribute release problem.
So that might be a problem for you.
And the solution to this is the attribute aggregator.
And this is this is a tool we create in the client process project and it collects names of released attributes.
Again only the names, not the values and it processes them and create some statistics and so on.
So the basic idea is really simple from the technical point of view the processing is really much more difficult than than just collecting names.
But this is simple tool which can really help us in achieving our goals.
How few more details the attribute aggregater it's a script that can be used with she bullet.
And that's most used Federation software.
And there is another script which is a bit less precise, but it can be used with any Federation software.
And then there is the web application, front end and back end.
And I'll hopefully the more interesting parts.

I will have some more pictures, some more Maps, so there are at the moment 9 participating service providers, so the message of this slide is please if you are a maintainer over service providers, don't hesitate to participate.
Just contact us and you will deploy the script once and from that time you will be monitored centrally.
So going on the map from from top to bottom, the dark.
Blue countries are the participating providers, the other COM the other.
Colors I'm not sure whether you see it.
Our plus, minus the members of clearing.
It's not precise, but it's plus minus.
So from top there are free service providers from finish clearing from CSC 2 from Germany from from Clarin D. There is one global on in declaring Eric Office.
Then there's a switch.
Is Delinda clearing the Czech Republic and then there are two which were the first when I don't count as the first 2 users of this attribute aggregator.
And that's clear in Italy.
Client ID and one service provider from Slovenia Mcclairen am so one more time.
Please join if there are any service provider maintainers.
The first URL is the link where you can find it.

At the moment you can access it with authentication, but maybe in future we will see the participating federations will always the participant service providers will always have access, but for the moment you can.
You can have a look at that, it's open source and it was deployed at the end of April, so it's really running on a couple of months and.
Service provides some of the service providers joined really recently.
The statistics the initial statistics were imported from our service provider which is deleted.
In the ID count has increased at the moment of.
I just created this slides.
I think 2 days ago.
So at the moment there are already 183 IDP's which means a user from one of 183 home institutions try to access clearing infrastructure using those nine service providers.
We don't.
We don't store the counts of how many ideas we have contacted, but we know that.
It's more than 10 which agreed to fix this attribute problems on the Clarion level.
On the client side level.
So for current and also for all the future service providers and SPF.
Um and there were also several Federation issues identified which have been also fixed, so the tool has been already improving the quality.
Now this is an interesting map as well, so these are those 183 or 180 IDP's on a map.
As you can see, there are also identity providers outside of the current SPF because some of the service providers are interface into federating.
Also using other federations.
But it's kind of clear that even there are users from America on the left side.
That's not.
That's not an error, that's how I.
But the most users come from from Europe, and here I have also one note that some of the national federations they expose only one identity provider.
This means that in Norway, if any of the home organizations try to access cloud infrastructure, we will always see it as one.
So the 182 or 83 that count is a bit ambiguous depending on what you really count, but for some countries.
We will always have only one.
So.
Now.
So this is how it looks.
The front end of the web application.
So on the left side.
Hopefully you can see it is an IDP identity provider saying when a user tried to authenticate via that IDP to which service provider.
In this case it's the University of Tampere to Corp.
There is a phase if it's smiling it means that there was nothing too bad.
Oh, in this case it was kind of OK because the attributes were released and you see all also very important other information you can cross check.

If everything is working because there are some means how to tackle the attribute release problem and you just you can be tagged and if both have the identity providers and the service provider have the same tag, they should release all the attributes the service provider request so you can also cross check some more information the the range, but you can check here is really big, but the important at the moment the important part is the smiling or non smile.
Face and when there is an unsmiling face at the moment, it means that the user or the identity provider hasn't released any identification.
What it means.
It means that I'm a service provider.
I know that the user selected home organization from the list.
He went there, he put in his username and password.
It was successful.
But all I got was a information that yes.
Nothing else, so yes, there was a user who tried to authenticate.
I don't know anything about him, so I really can't use it.
I don't have even his ID, so in this case there is the envelope direct envelope button and if you press that you will get.
An email created for you which has a lot of information for the identity provider.
Also for the service provider to keep track whom you already contacted and it says all the technical information including solution for them.
How to fix it on a Clarion level, saying that if they don't fix it on the Clarion level then they can have many more emails coming.
So this is the emails.
This is the most important feature.
So one click creating an email, but it has proved itself very important.
So now I'm going to the finish of this presentation.
So one more time because I think there were a lot of information.
So we created an attribute aggregator.
It collects attribute names, it identifies problematic connections when there are no attributes released when there is incorrect behavior.

You can report issues using one click and we can do it widely on all the participating service providers and also we can create very nice statistics as you have seen or Maps and then also counts and so on.
And.
The last slide is about future work, so there are still some national federations which tag clearance service providers in with a different tag.
So there is at the moment one we have to talk with them to change it.
So then the filters using the Clarion service provider Tag will work.
And there is also one important.
Project, which was done by by Martin from the finish clarine it's called Attribute Checker and it solved the following issue.

So when I'm a user and I access or service from the cloud infrastructure and the mandatory attributes were not released or none of that was released, I see usually an error page and when I see the URL I know it's the service in Clarion.
So what I think is the problem is inside the Clarion.
But this is not the case so.
Unless you have your own AI specific error messages, you can use this attribute checker and it will inform the user that yes, there was an error, but it's not us.
The problem is in your home organization, so please contact them or just wait for the others to solve it.
In our case it's the attribute aggregator so thank you.
